Rat Trap now arrives back at the scene where Ramulus stands, as the stegosa=
urous he rides stops beside him.

"Hey, good tim'n, just got your call, c'm=
on I'll take ya ta Night Shift, we gotta hurry because he's in major disrep=
air."

He holds a hand down to help Ramulus up onto the stegosaurous.  The =
older stego turns and waits for them to follow him.

"Oh, don't worry, thes=
e dinos are on our side.  This old guy's got his entire herd lookn' after N=
ight Shift."

Back where he had been left, Night Shift tries to sit up agai=
nst a boulder, and finds his legs completely useless.  This meant he could =
neither walk, or transform.  The stegos look to him curiously.

" I'll be o=
kay, no worries.  Slag, sure hate ben' in this situation though.  Night Shi=
ft ta Ramulus, Rat Trap's probably found ya by now, he'll take ya ta where =
I am, over."  

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonu=
s@...> wrote:

g sure he's unharmed. He smiles and rubs her nose.

iends are commn' back ta help me out."
> >
> > Meanwhile, another stego sco=
uts the area where Night Shift and Rat Trap had just fled. He had been with=
 the family originally, and appears to be one of the oldest members of the =
herd. He picks up a familliar scent, yet not Night Shift, but the scent of =
another comrade, and follows it. It leads him close to Ramulus. He spots th=
e Maximal, and waits for his approach, quietly gurgling his growl, and lowe=
ring his head as if to try and get him to follow him.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> When =
the Stegosauras spotted Ramulus, the Maximal was at the scene of
> the batt=
le. He was in robot mode skulking around the area, the smell
> of gunpowder=
 and burnt metal and smoke still hung in the air like a
> cloud. But for hi=
m it would seem that battle is over. There are no
> combatants, no explosio=
ns, and no bright flashes of light in the
> distance. All is quiet, except =
for a strange gurgling growling sound.
> 
> Ramulus looked over at the rath=
er strange acting Stegosauras. he gave
> it a quizzical look and tried to s=
hoo it away. "Hey big fella, you
> don't need to be around here. It might n=
ot be safe."
> 
> Meanwhile he turned his radio on. "Rat Trap, Nightshift. =
I am here at
> the site wher you called us from, but I don't see you." Ther=
e was a
> cautious and confused timber to his voice. "I can see the battle =
you
> were talking about, but there is no one left. It looks like half the
=
> forest was set ablaze though."
